intro: Pedicularis albolabiata, commonly known as the white-lipped monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a distinctive lip-like feature. It typically grows in alpine or subalpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is a subject of interest in both botanical research and horticultural cultivation.
